header: before getting to the content, let me just insert this selfie here:

Is your company looking for a Perl developer? The Perl Weekly can get your sponsored announcement to more than 5,000 readers every week. If that's not enough, your ad can also appear on the Perl Maven site visited by more that 10,000 Perl developers every day. Contact me (Gabor) for details.
And now let's go back the reguar listing of articles!

entries.title: Looking for Perl Gurus to work in exciting development environment
entries.text: Do you eat Javascript for lunch? Are you familiar with Web Servers such as IIS and Apache? Do you dig Perl the most? Then join Striata! We will make best use of your talent, while ensuring that you grow and learn in an environment that boasts some of the best developers in the industry. Apply now!

entries.title: Perl creator Larry Wall: Rethought version 6 due this year
entries.text: Paul Krill from InfoWorld interviewed Larry Wall via e-mail. Followed by extensive Reddit discussions.

chapters.title: Perl Maven Pro
chapters.header: The Perl Maven Pro subscribers receive two new articles and screencasts every week. The last week these were the two screencasts:

entries.title: Infinity Interactive is sponsoring the QA Hackathon
entries.author: neil_bowers
entries.text: Infinity is a small IT consultancy with HQ in New York and remote employees based all over the US and Canada.

entries.title: STRATO is sponsoring the QA Hackathon
entries.author: neil_bowers
entries.text: STRATO is an ISO 27001-certified hosting provider with its headquarters in Germany.

entries.title: GFU Cyrus AG is sponsoring the QA Hackathon
entries.author: tina_muller
entries.text: Cyrus AG is now one of the best-known IT training companies in Germany.

entries.title: Build a Reddit bot with Perl
entries.author: david_farrell
entries.text: Reddit is link-sharing and discussing site runnig on some open source Python code. It has so called 'subredits' that are categories for sharing links related to a specific topic. Posting an article on Reddit can get hudreds or thousands of additional visitors to an article, and via their aggregation it can expose the Perl-related activity to other communities as well.

entries.title: NAP::Messaging – Glue and policies for interacting with ActiveMQ
entries.author: gianni_ceccarelli
entries.text: Some secret sauce from Net-A-Porter giving us a peek behind the curtain of the fashion design. Who said you cannot combine beauty with Perl?

entries.title: Perl and the ElasticSearch percolator
entries.text: "Percolation is search inverted: instead of finding docs which match a particular query, it finds queries which match a particular document."

entries.title: Perl: Sourcing a profile or bashrc or other shell script SOLVED
entries.author: jason_froebe
entries.text: In the real world of Perl programmers you often need to work in strange envrionments. For some reason, unlike with Java programmers, they expect that you work around all the obstacles they put in front of you. And you do, because you are a Perl programmer who can work around strange issues. (Which of course reinforces their unreasonable expectations, but that's a different story.)

entries.title: Mojolicious Triumphs Over Legacy Code
entries.author: doug_bell
entries.text: What do you do if your old web application that was designed to accept a few hits an hour, suddenly gets hunderds of hits every minute from unfriendly Python scripts?

entries.title: Short survey of modules for combinations and permutations
entries.author: dana_jacobsen

entries.title: A Perl Review of the ODROID-C1
entries.author: timm_murray
entries.text: The ODROID-C1 is a competitor of the Raspberry Pi, a cheap "System on a Chip device". Timm Murray temorarily out of the Wumpus cave took a look at it from the perspective of a Perl developer.

entries.title: Fun with overload
entries.text: Pivot a multi-row/multi-column table, 4X4 in size for example, containing name-value pairs. Code should account for larger table sizes with any number of name-value pairs. Numbering the pairs is optional but encouraged for readability.

entries.title: GSoC: I need your ideas
entries.author: mark_keating
entries.text: Paul Johnson and Mark Keating are preparing the Perl team for the Google Summer of Code. They are looking for projets that want to participate.

entries.title: You're in a space of twisty little mazes, all alike
entries.author: carl_masak
entries.text: A 4x4 grid has 24 internal walls. In the power set of these, some of the members are "mazes", by definition grids with a unique path between every two squares. how many mazes exist?

entries.title: (xv) CPAN great modules released last week
(cxlvii) MetaCPAN weekly report - Moo
(clxxii) StackOverflow Perl report
Using the built-in debugger of Perl as REPL
entries.author: gabor_szabo
entries.text: An earlier screencast re-posted on the Perl Maven site.

entries.title: Select random elements from a weighted list
entries.text: Given N objects and N weights, select an element with its weighted probability.

entries.title: SVG - Scalable Vector Graphics with Perl
entries.author: gabor_szabo
entries.text: Some simple examples showing how to use the SVG Perl module to create Vector Graphics. Then, a related article was published on the Code Maven site using JavaScript to create SVG images, and there is even the beginning of an SVG tutorial with exercises.

entries.title: YAPC::NA - Hotel information - Master classes
entries.text: The organizers of YAPC::NA have put out a call for master classes and they sent out an e-mail with information about

>hotel reservation with a call for talks. I don't recall any announcement, announcing the announcment list, but if you managed to follow this sentence so far, and if you are interested in YAPC::NA related news,then you migh sign up here. The hotel information page mentions that there is an early-bird discount for the hotel rooms. (Unfortunately the talks won't be announced by that.)
